a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: How does extreme monetary poverty compare to multidimensional
Multidimensional poverty is defined as being deprived in a range of health, education and living standards indicators. Extreme
poverty is defined as living below the International Poverty Line of $2.15 per day.
Note: Poverty data is measured in international-$ at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it
relates to either disposable income or consumption per capita.
Data source: World Bank PIP; Alkire, Kanagaratnam and Suppa (2022)
